info.title: Stripe API v2
info.description:
The v2 endpoints of the Stripe REST API. Please see https://stripe.com/docs/api for more
    details.

get.description: Returns a list of Accounts.

parameters.name: applied_configurations
parameters.description: Filter only accounts that have all of the configurations specified. If omitted, returns all accounts regardless of which configurations they have.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The upper limit on the number of accounts returned by the List Account request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token to navigate to next or previous batch of accounts given by the list request.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

data.description: A list of retrieved Account objects.

post.description: An Account is a representation of a company, individual or other entity that a user interacts with. Accounts contain identifying information about the entity, and configurations that store the features an account has access to. An account can be configured as any or all of the following configurations: Customer, Merchant and/or Recipient.

exempt.description: Describes the customer's tax exemption status, which is `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the following text: “Reverse charge”.

ip_address.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

location_source.description: The data source used to identify the customer's tax location - defaults to 'identity_address'. Will only be used for automatic tax calculation on the customer's Invoices and Subscriptions.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Automatic indirect tax settings to be used when automatic tax calculation is enabled on the customer's invoices, subscriptions, checkout sessions, or payment links. Surfaces if automatic tax calculation is possible given the current customer location information.

custom_fields.description: The list of up to 4 default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

name.description: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 40 characters.

value.description: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 140 characters. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined values.

footer.description: Default footer to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

next_sequence.description: The sequence to be used on the customer's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

prefix.description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3–12 uppercase letters or numbers.

amount_tax_display.description: How line-item prices and amounts will be displayed with respect to tax on invoice PDFs. One of exclude_tax or include_inclusive_tax. include_inclusive_tax will include inclusive tax (and exclude exclusive tax) in invoice PDF amounts. exclude_tax will exclude all tax (inclusive and exclusive alike) from invoice PDF amounts.

template.description: ID of the invoice rendering template to use for future invoices.

rendering.description: Default options for invoice PDF rendering for this customer.

invoice.description: Default settings used on invoices for this customer.

billing.description: Billing settings - default settings used for this customer in Billing flows such as Invoices and Subscriptions.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Generates requirements for enabling automatic indirect tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Recommended to request this capability if planning to enable automatic tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Uses the `location_source` field.

capabilities.description: Capabilities that have been requested on the Customer Configuration.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

shipping.description: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

test_clock.description: ID of the test clock to attach to the customer. Can only be set on testmode Accounts, and when the Customer Configuration is first set on an Account.

customer.description: The Customer Configuration allows the Account to be used in inbound payment flows.

display_name.description: Display name for Bacs debit payments.

bacs_debit_payments.description: Settings used for Bacs debit payments.

icon.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): An icon for the merchant. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.

logo.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): A logo for the merchant that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the merchant's name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

primary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for the merchant.

secondary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the secondary branding color for the merchant.

branding.description: Settings used to apply the merchant's branding to email receipts, invoices, Checkout, and other products.

capabilities.description: Capabilities to request on the Merchant Configuration.

avs_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

cvc_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

decline_on.description: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

mcc.description: The merchant category code for the Merchant Configuration. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

address.description: A publicly available mailing address for sending support issues to.

email.description: A publicly available email address for sending support issues to.

url.description: A publicly available website for handling support issues.

support.description: Publicly available contact information for sending support issues to.

merchant.description: The Merchant configuration allows the Account to act as a connected account and collect payments facilitated by a Connect platform. You can add this configuration to your connected accounts only if you’ve completed onboarding as a Connect platform.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

stripe_balance.description: Capabilities that enable the recipient to manage their Stripe Balance (/v1/balance).

capabilities.description: Capabilities to be requested on the Recipient Configuration.

recipient.description: The Recipient Configuration allows the Account to receive funds.

bank_accounts.description: Can provision a bank-account-like financial address (VBAN) to credit/debit a FinancialAccount.

financial_addresses.description: Can provision a financial address to credit/debit a FinancialAccount.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

gbp.description: Can hold storage-type funds on Stripe in GBP.

holds_currencies.description: Can hold storage-type funds on Stripe.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

bank_accounts.description: Can pull funds from an external bank account owned by yourself to a FinancialAccount.

inbound_transfers.description: Can pull funds from an external source, owned by yourself, to a FinancialAccount.

bank_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a bank account owned by someone else.

cards.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a debit card owned by someone else.

financial_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to another FinancialAccount owned by someone else.

outbound_payments.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a destination owned by someone else.

bank_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a bank account owned by yourself.

financial_accounts.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to another FinancialAccount owned by yourself.

outbound_transfers.description: Can send funds from a FinancialAccount to a destination owned by yourself.

capabilities.description: Capabilities to request on the Storer Configuration.

storer.description: The Storer Configuration allows the Account to store and move funds using stored-value FinancialAccounts.

configuration.description: An Account Configuration which allows the Account to take on a key persona across Stripe products.

contact_email.description: The default contact email address for the Account. Required when configuring the account as a merchant or recipient.

dashboard.description: A value indicating the Stripe dashboard this Account has access to. This will depend on which configurations are enabled for this account.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

locales.description: The Account's preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

fees_collector.description: A value indicating the party responsible for collecting fees from this account.

losses_collector.description: A value indicating who is responsible for losses when this Account can’t pay back negative balances from payments.

responsibilities.description: Default responsibilities held by either Stripe or the platform.

defaults.description: Default values to be used on Account Configurations.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for the Account. This name will be surfaced in the Stripe Dashboard and on any invoices sent to the Account.

date.description: The time marking when the director attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the director attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the director attestation was made.

directorship_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the directors information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

date.description: The time marking when the beneficial owner attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

ownership_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

directors.description: Whether the company’s directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s directors with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

executives.description: Whether the company’s executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s executives with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

owners.description: Whether the company’s owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s owners with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

ownership_exemption_reason.description: Reason for why the company is exempt from providing ownership information.

persons_provided.description: Attestation that all Persons with a specific Relationship value have been provided.

date.description: The time when the Account's representative accepted the terms of service. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

account.description: Details on the Account's acceptance of the [Stripe Services Agreement](https://docs.stripe.com/connect/updating-accounts#tos-acceptance).

attestations.description: Attestations from the identity's key people, e.g. owners, executives, directors.

fiscal_year_end.description: The close-out date of the preceding fiscal year in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2023-12-31 for the 31st of December, 2023.

annual_revenue.description: The business gross annual revenue for its preceding fiscal year.

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The “presentment amount” to be collected from the customer.

cadence.description: The frequency of the underlying payment.

customer.description: ID of the Customer to which this OffSessionPayment belongs.

metadata.description:
Set of [key-value pairs](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/api/metadata) that you can
attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about
the object in a structured format. Learn more about
[storing information in metadata](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/payments/payment-intents#storing-information-in-metadata).

on_behalf_of.description: The account (if any) for which the funds of the OffSessionPayment are intended.

payment_method.description: ID of the payment method used in this OffSessionPayment.

retry_strategy.description: Indicates the strategy for how you want Stripe to retry the payment.

statement_descriptor.description:
Text that appears on the customer’s statement as the statement descriptor for a
non-card charge. This value overrides the account’s default statement descriptor.
For information about requirements, including the 22-character limit, see the
[Statement Descriptor docs](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors).

statement_descriptor_suffix.description:
Provides information about a card charge. Concatenated to the account’s
[statement descriptor prefix](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#static)
to form the complete statement descriptor that appears on the customer’s statement.

test_clock.description: Test clock that can be used to advance the retry attempts in a sandbox.

amount.description:
The amount transferred to the destination account. This transfer will occur
automatically after the payment succeeds. If no amount is specified, by default
the entire payment amount is transferred to the destination account. The amount
must be less than or equal to the
[amount_requested](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/api/v2/off-session-payments/object?api-version=2025-05-28.preview#v2_off_session_payment_object-amount_requested),
and must be a positive integer representing how much to transfer in the smallest
currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00).

destination.description:
The account (if any) that the payment is attributed to for tax reporting, and
where funds from the payment are transferred to after payment success.

transfer_data.description: The data that automatically creates a Transfer after the payment finalizes. Learn more about the use case for [connected accounts](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/payments/connected-accounts).

account.description: The ID of the Account to create link for.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). If you don’t specify collection_options, the default value is currently_due.

future_requirements.description: Specifies whether the platform collects future_requirements in addition to requirements in Connect Onboarding. The default value is `omit`.

collection_options.description: Specifies the requirements that Stripe collects from v2/core/accounts in the Onboarding flow.

configurations.description: Open Enum. A v2/core/account can be configured to enable certain functionality. The configuration param targets the v2/core/account_link to collect information for the specified v2/core/account configuration/s.

refresh_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to if the AccountLink is expired, has been used, or is otherwise invalid. The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new AccountLink with the same parameters used to create the original AccountLink, then redirect the user to the new AccountLink’s URL so they can continue the flow. If a new AccountLink cannot be generated or the redirect fails you should display a useful error to the user. Please make sure to implement authentication before redirecting the user in case this URL is leaked to a third party.

return_url.description: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon completing the linked flow.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). If you don’t specify collection_options, the default value is currently_due.

Describes the currency to send to the recipient.
If included, this currency must match a currency supported by the destination.
Can be omitted in the following cases:
- destination only supports one currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the FA currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the presentment currency
Note - when both FA currency and presentment currency are supported, we pick the FA currency to minimize FX.

post.description: Creates an OutboundPaymentQuote usable in an OutboundPayment.

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The "presentment amount" to be sent to the recipient.

bank_account.description: Open Enum. Method for bank account.

delivery_options.description: Method to be used to send the OutboundPayment.

currency.description: Describes the FinancialAccount's currency drawn from.

financial_account.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

from.description: Request details about the sender of an OutboundPaymentQuote.

currency.description:
Describes the currency to send to the recipient.
If included, this currency must match a currency supported by the destination.
Can be omitted in the following cases:
- destination only supports one currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the FA currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the presentment currency
Note - when both FA currency and presentment currency are supported, we pick the FA currency to minimize FX.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundPayment uses to send payout.

recipient.description: To which account the OutboundPayment is sent.

to.description: Request details about the recipient of an OutboundPaymentQuote.

post.description: Creates a meter event. Events are validated synchronously, but are processed asynchronously. Supports up to 1,000 events per second in livemode. For higher rate-limits, please use meter event streams instead.

event_name.description: The name of the meter event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier for the event. If not provided, one will be generated.
We recommend using a globally unique identifier for this. We’ll enforce
uniqueness within a rolling 24 hour period.

payload.description:
The payload of the event. This must contain the fields corresponding to a meter’s
`customer_mapping.event_payload_key` (default is `stripe_customer_id`) and
`value_settings.event_payload_key` (default is `value`). Read more about
the
[payload](https://docs.stripe.com/billing/subscriptions/usage-based/recording-usage#payload-key-overrides).

timestamp.description:
The time of the event. Must be within the past 35 calendar days or up to
5 minutes in the future. Defaults to current timestamp if not specified.

applied.description: Represents the state of the configuration, and can be updated to deactivate or re-apply a configuration.

exempt.description: Describes the customer's tax exemption status, which is `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the following text: “Reverse charge”.

ip_address.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

location_source.description: The data source used to identify the customer's tax location - defaults to 'identity_address'. Will only be used for automatic tax calculation on the customer's Invoices and Subscriptions.

validate_location.description: A per-request flag that indicates when Stripe should validate the customer tax location - defaults to 'auto'.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Automatic indirect tax settings to be used when automatic tax calculation is enabled on the customer's invoices, subscriptions, checkout sessions, or payment links. Surfaces if automatic tax calculation is possible given the current customer location information.

default_payment_method.description: ID of a payment method that’s attached to the customer, to be used as the customer’s default payment method for invoices and subscriptions.

custom_fields.description: The list of up to 4 default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

name.description: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 40 characters.

value.description: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 140 characters. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined values.

footer.description: Default footer to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

next_sequence.description: The sequence to be used on the customer's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

prefix.description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3–12 uppercase letters or numbers.

amount_tax_display.description: How line-item prices and amounts will be displayed with respect to tax on invoice PDFs. One of exclude_tax or include_inclusive_tax. include_inclusive_tax will include inclusive tax (and exclude exclusive tax) in invoice PDF amounts. exclude_tax will exclude all tax (inclusive and exclusive alike) from invoice PDF amounts.

template.description: ID of the invoice rendering template to use for future invoices.

rendering.description: Default options for invoice PDF rendering for this customer.

invoice.description: Default settings used on invoices for this customer.

billing.description: Billing settings - default settings used for this customer in Billing flows such as Invoices and Subscriptions.

requested.description: To request a new Capability for an account, pass true. There can be a delay before the requested Capability becomes active.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Generates requirements for enabling automatic indirect tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Recommended to request this capability if planning to enable automatic tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Uses the `location_source` field.

capabilities.description: Capabilities that have been requested on the Customer Configuration.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

shipping.description: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

test_clock.description: ID of the test clock to attach to the customer. Can only be set on testmode Accounts, and when the Customer Configuration is first set on an Account.

customer.description: The Customer Configuration allows the Account to be charged.

applied.description: Represents the state of the configuration, and can be updated to deactivate or re-apply a configuration.

display_name.description: Display name for Bacs debit payments.

capabilities.description: Capabilities to request on the Merchant Configuration.

avs_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

cvc_failure.description: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

decline_on.description: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

mcc.description: The merchant category code for the merchant. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

email.description: A publicly available email address for sending support issues to.

phone.description: A publicly available phone number to call with support issues.

support.description: Publicly available contact information for sending support issues to.

directors.description: Whether the company’s directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s directors with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

front_back.description: The [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) tokens referring to each side of the document.

type.description: The format of the verification document. Currently supports `front_back` only.

secondary_verification.description: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

files.description: One or more document IDs returned by a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file) with a purpose value of `account_requirement`.

type.description: The format of the document. Currently supports `files` only.

visa.description: One or more documents showing the person’s visa required for living in the country where they are residing.

documents.description: Documents that may be submitted to satisfy various informational requests.

given_name.description: The individual's first name.

id_numbers.description: The identification numbers (e.g., SSN) associated with the individual.

type.description: The ID number type of an individual.

value.description: The value of the ID number.

legal_gender.description: The individual's gender (International regulations require either "male" or "female").

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

nationalities.description: The countries where the individual is a national. Two-letter country code ([ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)).

director.description: Whether the person is a director of the account's identity. Directors are typically members of the governing board of the company, or responsible for ensuring the company meets its regulatory obligations.

executive.description: Whether the person has significant responsibility to control, manage, or direct the organization.

owner.description: Whether the person is an owner of the account’s identity.

percent_ownership.description: The percent owned by the person of the account's legal entity.

title.description: The person's title (e.g., CEO, Support Engineer).

relationship.description: The relationship that this individual has with the account's identity.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

get.description: Returns a list of OutboundPayments that match the provided filters.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created at the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_gt
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created after the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_gte
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created on or after the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_lt
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created before the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: created_lte
parameters.description:
Filter for objects created on or before the specified timestamp.
Must be an RFC 3339 date & time value, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:00Z.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page token to use to retrieve the page being requested.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: Only return OutboundPayments sent to this recipient.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Closed Enum. Only return OutboundPayments with this status.

next_page_url.description: URL to fetch the next page of the list. If there are no more pages, the value is null.

previous_page_url.description: URL to fetch the previous page of the list. If there are no previous pages, the value is null.

post.description: Creates an OutboundPayment.

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: The "presentment amount" to be sent to the recipient.

bank_account.description: Open Enum. Method for bank account.

delivery_options.description: Delivery options to be used to send the OutboundPayment.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the OutboundPayment. Often useful for displaying to users.

currency.description: Describes the FinancialAmount's currency drawn from.

financial_account.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

from.description: From which FinancialAccount and BalanceType to pull funds from.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

outbound_payment_quote.description: The quote for this OutboundPayment. Only required for countries with regulatory mandates to display fee estimates before OutboundPayment creation.

setting.description:
Closed Enum. Configuration option to enable or disable notifications to recipients.
Do not send notifications when setting is NONE. Default to account setting when setting is CONFIGURED or not set.

recipient_notification.description: Details about the notification settings for the OutboundPayment recipient.

currency.description:
Describes the currency to send to the recipient.
If included, this currency must match a currency supported by the destination.
Can be omitted in the following cases:
- destination only supports one currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the FA currency
- destination supports multiple currencies and one of the currencies matches the presentment currency
Note - when both FA currency and presentment currency are supported, we pick the FA currency to minimize FX.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundPayment uses to send payout.

recipient.description: To which account the OutboundPayment is sent.

to.description: To which payout method to send the OutboundPayment.

post.description: Creates a meter event session to send usage on the high-throughput meter event stream. Authentication tokens are only valid for 15 minutes, so you will need to create a new meter event session when your token expires.
Unarchive an PayoutMethod object.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Payout Method.

post.description: Enable an event destination.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier for the event destination to enable.

v1.billing.meter.no_meter_found.description: Occurs when a Meter's id is missing or invalid in async usage events.

created.description: The creation time of this meter event.

event_name.description: The name of the meter event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the event. If not provided, one will be generated. We recommend using a globally unique identifier for this. We’ll enforce uniqueness within a rolling 24 hour period.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

payload.description:
The payload of the event. This must contain the fields corresponding to a meter’s
`customer_mapping.event_payload_key` (default is `stripe_customer_id`) and
`value_settings.event_payload_key` (default is `value`). Read more about the payload.

timestamp.description:
The time of the event. Must be within the past 35 calendar days or up to
5 minutes in the future. Defaults to current timestamp if not specified.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

identifier.description: Unique identifier for the event. You can only cancel events within 24 hours of Stripe receiving them.

created.description: The time the adjustment was created.

event_name.description: The name of the meter event. Corresponds with the `event_name` field on a meter.

id.description: The unique id of this meter event adjustment.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

status.description: Open Enum. The meter event adjustment’s status.

type.description: Open Enum. Specifies whether to cancel a single event or a range of events for a time period. Time period cancellation is not supported yet.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

authentication_token.description:
The authentication token for this session.  Use this token when calling the
high-throughput meter event API.

created.description: The creation time of this session.

expires_at.description: The time at which this session will expire.

id.description: The unique id of this auth session.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

applied_configurations.description: Filter only accounts that have all of the configurations specified. If omitted, returns all accounts regardless of which configurations they have.

applied.description: Represents the state of the configuration, and can be updated to deactivate or re-apply a configuration.

exempt.description: Describes the customer's tax exemption status, which is `none`, `exempt`, or `reverse`. When set to reverse, invoice and receipt PDFs include the following text: “Reverse charge”.

ip_address.description: A recent IP address of the customer used for tax reporting and tax location inference.

country.description: The identified tax country of the customer.

state.description: The identified tax state, county, province, or region of the customer.

location.description: The customer’s identified tax location - uses `location_source`. Will only be rendered if the `automatic_indirect_tax` feature is requested and `active`.

location_source.description: The data source used to identify the customer's tax location - defaults to 'identity_address'. Will only be used for automatic tax calculation on the customer's Invoices and Subscriptions.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Automatic indirect tax settings to be used when automatic tax calculation is enabled on the customer's invoices, subscriptions, checkout sessions, or payment links. Surfaces if automatic tax calculation is possible given the current customer location information.

default_payment_method.description: ID of a payment method that’s attached to the customer, to be used as the customer’s default payment method for invoices and subscriptions.

custom_fields.description: The list of up to 4 default custom fields to be displayed on invoices for this customer. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined fields.

name.description: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 40 characters.

value.description: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 140 characters. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined values.

footer.description: Default footer to be displayed on invoices for this customer.

next_sequence.description: The sequence to be used on the customer's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

prefix.description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3–12 uppercase letters or numbers.

amount_tax_display.description: How line-item prices and amounts will be displayed with respect to tax on invoice PDFs. One of exclude_tax or include_inclusive_tax. include_inclusive_tax will include inclusive tax (and exclude exclusive tax) in invoice PDF amounts. exclude_tax will exclude all tax (inclusive and exclusive alike) from invoice PDF amounts.

template.description: ID of the invoice rendering template to use for future invoices.

rendering.description: Default options for invoice PDF rendering for this customer.

invoice.description: Default settings used on invoices for this customer.

billing.description: Billing settings - default settings used for this customer in Billing flows such as Invoices and Subscriptions.

requested.description: Whether the Capability has been requested.

status_details.description: Additional details regarding the status of the Capability. `status_details` will be empty if the Capability's status is `active`.

code.description: Machine-readable code explaining the reason for the Capability to be in its current status.

resolution.description: Machine-readable code explaining how to make the Capability active.

automatic_indirect_tax.description: Generates requirements for enabling automatic indirect tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Recommended to request this capability if planning to enable automatic tax calculation on this customer's invoices or subscriptions. Uses the `location_source` field.

capabilities.description: Capabilities that have been requested on the Customer Configuration.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

shipping.description: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

test_clock.description: ID of the test clock to attach to the customer. Can only be set on testmode Accounts, and when the Customer Configuration is first set on an Account.

customer.description: The Customer Configuration allows the Account to be used in inbound payment flows.

applied.description: Represents the state of the configuration, and can be updated to deactivate or re-apply a configuration.

logo.description: ID of a [file upload](https://docs.stripe.com/api/persons/update#create_file): A logo for the merchant that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the merchant's name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

primary_color.description: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for the merchant.

descriptor.description: The default text that appears on statements for non-card charges outside of Japan. For card charges, if you don’t set a statement_descriptor_prefix, this text is also used as the statement descriptor prefix. In that case, if concatenating the statement descriptor suffix causes the combined statement descriptor to exceed 22 characters, we truncate the statement_descriptor text to limit the full descriptor to 22 characters. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

prefix.description: Default text that appears on statements for card charges outside of Japan, prefixing any dynamic statement_descriptor_suffix specified on the charge. To maximize space for the dynamic part of the descriptor, keep this text short. If you don’t specify this value, statement_descriptor is used as the prefix. For more information about statement descriptors and their requirements, see the Merchant Configuration settings documentation.

contact_email.description: The default contact email address for the Account. Required when configuring the account as a merchant or recipient.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

dashboard.description: A value indicating the Stripe dashboard this Account has access to. This will depend on which configurations are enabled for this account.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

locales.description: The Account's preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

fees_collector.description: A value indicating the responsible payer of a bundle of Stripe fees for pricing-control eligible products on this Account.

losses_collector.description: A value indicating who is responsible for losses when this Account can’t pay back negative balances from payments.

responsibilities.description: Default responsibilities held by either Stripe or the platform.

defaults.description: Default values to be used on Account Configurations.

display_name.description: A descriptive name for the Account. This name will be surfaced in the Stripe Dashboard and on any invoices sent to the Account.

date.description: The time marking when the director attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

ip.description: The IP address from which the director attestation was made.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the director attestation was made.

directorship_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the directors information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

date.description: The time marking when the beneficial owner attestation was made. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the beneficial owner attestation was made.

ownership_declaration.description: This hash is used to attest that the beneficial owner information provided to Stripe is both current and correct.

directors.description: Whether the company’s directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s directors with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

executives.description: Whether the company’s executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s executives with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

owners.description: Whether the company’s owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company’s owners with the [Persons API](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/core/accounts/createperson).

ownership_exemption_reason.description: Reason for why the company is exempt from providing ownership information.

persons_provided.description: Attestation that all Persons with a specific Relationship value have been provided.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the browser from which the Account's representative accepted the terms of service.

fields.description: Specifies whether the platform collects only currently_due requirements (`currently_due`) or both currently_due and eventually_due requirements (`eventually_due`). If you don’t specify collection_options, the default value is currently_due.

future_requirements.description: Specifies whether the platform collects future_requirements in addition to requirements in Connect Onboarding. The default value is `omit`.

refresh_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to if the AccountLink is expired, has been used, or is otherwise invalid. The URL you specify should attempt to generate a new AccountLink with the same parameters used to create the original AccountLink, then redirect the user to the new AccountLink’s URL so they can continue the flow. If a new AccountLink cannot be generated or the redirect fails you should display a useful error to the user. Please make sure to implement authentication before redirecting the user in case this URL is leaked to a third party.

v2.core.event.description: Events are generated to keep you informed of activity in your business account. APIs in the /v2 namespace generate [thin events](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations#benefits-of-thin-events) which have small, unversioned payloads that include a reference to the ID of the object that has changed. The Events v2 API returns these new thin events. [Retrieve the event object](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations#fetch-data) for additional data about the event. Use the related object ID in the event payload to [fetch the API resource](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations#retrieve-the-object-associated-with-thin-events) of the object associated with the event. Comparatively, events generated by most API v1 include a versioned snapshot of an API object in their payload.

snapshot_api_version.description: If using the snapshot event payload, the API version events are rendered as.

status.description: Status. It can be set to either enabled or disabled.

reason.description: Reason event destination has been disabled.

disabled.description: Details about why the event destination has been disabled.

status_details.description: Additional information about event destination status.

type.description: Event destination type.

updated.description: Time at which the object was last updated.

url.description: The URL of the webhook endpoint, includable.

v2.core.event_destination.description: Set up an event destination to receive events from Stripe across multiple destination types, including [webhook endpoints](https://docs.stripe.com/webhooks) and [Amazon EventBridge](https://docs.stripe.com/event-destinations/eventbridge). Event destinations support receiving [thin events](https://docs.stripe.com/api/v2/events) and [snapshot events](https://docs.stripe.com/api/events).

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.core.event_destination.ping.description: A ping event used to test the connection to an EventDestination.

archived.description:
Whether this bank account object was archived. Bank account objects can be archived through
the /archive API, and they will not be automatically archived by Stripe. Archived bank account objects
cannot be used as outbound destinations and will not appear in the outbound destination list.

bank_account_type.description: Closed Enum. The type of the bank account (checking or savings).

created.description: When the CoP result was created.

match_result.description: Whether or not the information of the bank account matches what you have provided. Closed enum.

business_type.description:
The business type given by the bank for this account, in case of a MATCH or PARTIAL_MATCH.
Closed enum.

name.description: The name given by the bank for this account, in case of a MATCH or PARTIAL_MATCH.

matched.description: The fields that CoP service matched against. Only has value if MATCH or PARTIAL_MATCH, empty otherwise.

message.description: Human-readable message describing the match result.

business_type.description: The provided or Legal Entity business type to match against the CoP service. Closed enum.

name.description: The provided or Legal Entity name to match against the CoP service.

provided.description: The fields that are matched against what the network has on file.

result.description: The result of the Confirmation of Payee check, once the check has been initiated. Closed enum.

status.description: The current state of Confirmation of Payee on this bank account. Closed enum.

confirmation_of_payee.description:
Information around the status of Confirmation of Payee matching done on this bank account.
Confirmation of Payee is a name matching service that must be done before making OutboundPayments in the UK.

created.description: Creation time.

id.description: The ID of the GBBankAccount object.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the account number or IBAN.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

sort_code.description: The Sort Code of the bank account.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.core.vault.gb_bank_account.description: Use the GBBankAccounts API to create and manage GB bank account objects

archived.description: Whether this USBankAccount object was archived.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank this bank account belongs to. This field is populated automatically by Stripe based on the routing number.

fedwire_routing_number.description: The fedwire routing number of the bank account.

id.description: The ID of the USBankAccount object.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the account number.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

routing_number.description: The ACH routing number of the bank account.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

storage.description: If this is a `storage` FinancialAccount, this hash includes details specific to `storage` FinancialAccounts.

amount.description: The "presentment amount" for the OutboundPayment.

cancelable.description: Returns true if the OutboundPayment can be canceled, and false otherwise.

created.description:
Time at which the OutboundPayment was created.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

bank_account.description: Open Enum. Method for bank account.

delivery_options.description: Delivery options to be used to send the OutboundPayment.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the OutboundPayment. Often useful for displaying to users.

expected_arrival_date.description:
The date when funds are expected to arrive in the payout method. This field is not set if the payout method is in a `failed`, `canceled`, or `returned` state.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

debited.description: The monetary amount debited from the sender, only set on responses.

financial_account.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

from.description: The FinancialAccount that funds were pulled from.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

outbound_payment_quote.description: The quote for this OutboundPayment. Only required for countries with regulatory mandates to display fee estimates before OutboundPayment creation.

receipt_url.description: A link to the Stripe-hosted receipt for this OutboundPayment. The receipt link remains active for 60 days from the OutboundPayment creation date. After this period, the link will expire and the receipt url value will be null.

setting.description:
Closed Enum. Configuration option to enable or disable notifications to recipients.
Do not send notifications when setting is NONE. Default to account setting when setting is CONFIGURED or not set.

recipient_notification.description: Details about the OutboundPayment notification settings for recipient.

statement_descriptor.description: The description that appears on the receiving end for an OutboundPayment (for example, bank statement for external bank transfer). It will default to `STRIPE` if not set on the account settings.

status.description:
Closed Enum. Current status of the OutboundPayment: `processing`, `failed`, `posted`, `returned`, `canceled`.
An OutboundPayment is `processing` if it has been created and is processing.
The status changes to `posted` once the OutboundPayment has been "confirmed" and funds have left the account, or to `failed` or `canceled`.
If an OutboundPayment fails to arrive at its payout method, its status will change to `returned`.

status_details.description: Status details for an OutboundPayment in a `failed` or `returned` state.

canceled_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `canceled`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

failed_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `failed`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

posted_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `posted`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

returned_at.description:
Timestamp describing when an OutboundPayment changed status to `returned`.
Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

status_transitions.description: Hash containing timestamps of when the object transitioned to a particular status.

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

credited.description: The monetary amount being credited to the destination.

payout_method.description: The payout method which the OutboundPayment uses to send payout.

recipient.description: To which account the OutboundPayment is sent.

to.description: To which payout method the OutboundPayment was sent.

status.description:
Possible values are `pending`, `supported`, and `unsupported`. Initially set to `pending`, it changes to
`supported` when the recipient bank provides a trace ID, or `unsupported` if the recipient bank doesn't support it.
Note that this status may not align with the OutboundPayment or OutboundTransfer status and can remain `pending`
even after the payment or transfer is posted.

value.description: The trace ID value if `trace_id.status` is `supported`, otherwise empty.

trace_id.description: A unique identifier that can be used to track this OutboundPayment with recipient bank. Banks might call this a “reference number” or something similar.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

Closed Enum. Current status of the OutboundTransfer: `processing`, `failed`, `posted`, `returned`, `canceled`.

If an OutboundTransfer fails to arrive at its payout method, its status will change to `returned`.

status.description:
Closed Enum. Current status of the Transaction.
A Transaction is `pending` if either `balance_impact.inbound_pending` or `balance_impact.outbound_pending` is non-zero.
A Transaction is `posted` if only `balance_impact.available` is non-zero.
A Transaction is `void` if there is no balance impact.
`posted` and `void` are terminal states, and no additional entries will be added to the Transaction.

posted_at.description: The time at which the Transaction became posted. Only present if status == posted.

void_at.description: The time at which the Transaction became void. Only present if status == void.

status_transitions.description: Timestamps for when the Transaction transitioned to a particular status.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.money_management.transaction.description: Use Transactions to view changes to your FinancialAccount balance over time. Every flow that moves money, such as OutboundPayments or ReceivedCredits, will have one or more Transactions that describes how the flow impacted your balance. Note that while the FinancialAccount balance will always be up to date, be aware that Transactions and TransactionEntries are created shortly after to reflect changes.

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

balance_impact.description: The delta to the FinancialAccount's balance.

created.description: Time at which the object was created.

effective_at.description: Time at which the entry impacted (or will impact if it's in the future) the FinancialAccount balance.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

transaction.description: The Transaction that this TransactionEntry belongs to.

category.description: Closed Enum for now, and will be turned into an Open Enum soon. A descriptive category used to classify the Transaction.

financial_account.description: Indicates the FinancialAccount affected by this Transaction.

type.description: Open Enum. Type of the flow that created the Transaction. The field matching this value will contain the ID of the flow.

adjustment.description: If applicable, the ID of the Adjustment that created this Transaction.

currency_conversion.description: In the future, this will be the ID of the currency conversion that created this Transaction. For now, this field is always null.

fee_transaction.description: If applicable, the ID of the FeeTransaction that created this Transaction.

inbound_transfer.description: If applicable, the ID of the InboundTransfer that created this Transaction.

outbound_payment.description: If applicable, the ID of the OutboundPayment that created this Transaction.

outbound_transfer.description: If applicable, the ID of the OutboundTransfer that created this Transaction.

received_credit.description: If applicable, the ID of the ReceivedCredit that created this Transaction.

received_debit.description: If applicable, the ID of the ReceivedDebit that created this Transaction.

flow.description: Details about the Flow object that created the Transaction.

transaction_details.description: Details copied from the transaction that this TransactionEntry belongs to.

livemode.description: Has the value `true` if the object exists in live mode or the value `false` if the object exists in test mode.

v2.money_management.transaction_entry.description: TransactionEntries represent individual money movements across different states within a Transaction.

amount.description: A non-negative integer representing how much to charge in the [smallest currency unit](https://docs.stripe.com/currencies#minor-units).

currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html), in lowercase. Must be a [supported currency](https://stripe.com/docs/currencies).

amount_requested.description: The “presentment amount” to be collected from the customer.

cadence.description: The frequency of the underlying payment.

created.description:
Creation time of the OffSessionPayment. Represented as a RFC 3339 date & time UTC
value in millisecond precision, for example: 2022-09-18T13:22:18.123Z.

customer.description: ID of the Customer to which this OffSessionPayment belongs.

failure_reason.description: The reason why the OffSessionPayment failed.

last_authorization_attempt_error.description: The payment error encountered in the previous attempt to authorize the payment.

latest_payment_attempt_record.description: Payment attempt record for the latest attempt, if one exists.

livemode.description: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

metadata.description:
Set of [key-value pairs](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/api/metadata) that you can
attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about
the object in a structured format. Learn more about
[storing information in metadata](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/payments/payment-intents#storing-information-in-metadata).

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value of the object field.

on_behalf_of.description: The account (if any) for which the funds of the OffSessionPayment are intended.

payment_method.description: ID of the payment method used in this OffSessionPayment.

payment_record.description: Payment record associated with the OffSessionPayment.

attempts.description: Number of authorization attempts so far.

retry_strategy.description: Indicates the strategy for how you want Stripe to retry the payment.

statement_descriptor.description:
Text that appears on the customer’s statement as the statement descriptor for a
non-card charge. This value overrides the account’s default statement descriptor.
For information about requirements, including the 22-character limit, see the
[Statement Descriptor docs](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors).

statement_descriptor_suffix.description:
Provides information about a card charge. Concatenated to the account’s
[statement descriptor prefix](https://docs.stripe.com/get-started/account/statement-descriptors#static)
to form the complete statement descriptor that appears on the customer’s statement.

status.description:
Status of this OffSessionPayment, one of `pending`, `pending_retry`, `processing`,
`failed`, `canceled`, `requires_capture`, or `succeeded`.

test_clock.description: Test clock that can be used to advance the retry attempts in a sandbox.

amount.description:
The amount transferred to the destination account. This transfer will occur
automatically after the payment succeeds. If no amount is specified, by default
the entire payment amount is transferred to the destination account. The amount
must be less than or equal to the
[amount_requested](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/api/v2/off-session-payments/object?api-version=2025-05-28.preview#v2_off_session_payment_object-amount_requested),
and must be a positive integer representing how much to transfer in the smallest
currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00).

destination.description:
The account (if any) that the payment is attributed to for tax reporting, and
where funds from the payment are transferred to after payment success.

transfer_data.description: The data that automatically creates a Transfer after the payment finalizes. Learn more about the use case for [connected accounts](https://docs.corp.stripe.com/payments/connected-accounts).

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.payments.off_session_payment.authoriz.description: Sent after a failed authorization if there are still retries available on the OffSessionPayment.

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.payments.off_session_payment.authoriz.description:
Sent when our internal scheduling system kicks off an attempt at authorization, whether it's a
retry or an initial authorization.

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.payments.off_session_payment.canceled.description: Sent immediately following a user's call to the Off-Session Payments cancel endpoint.

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.payments.off_session_payment.created.description: Sent immediately following a user's call to the Off-Session Payments create endpoint.

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.payments.off_session_payment.failed.description: Sent after a failed authorization if there are no retries remaining, or if the failure is unretryable.

type.description: Object tag of the resource relevant to the event.

related_object.description: Object containing the reference to API resource relevant to the event.

type.description: The type of the event.

v2.payments.off_session_payment.succeede.description: Sent immediately after a successful authorization.

basicAuth.description: Basic HTTP authentication. Allowed headers-- Authorization: Basic <api_key> | Authorization: Basic <base64 hash of `api_key:`>

bearerAuth.description: Bearer HTTP authentication. Allowed headers-- Authorization: Bearer <api_key>
